page.title: 06Caring for the Elderly
page.content: Our school has built up over the years close links with the residents of Stanton House, which is a nearby sheltered housing scheme for the elderly. Each year, at Christmas, the residents are collected from their flats and brought to school where their hosts are the fourth-year children. They have afternoon tea, and are then entertained by the children before returning home. Also, in early October, the children are asked to bring to school items of food for our Harvest Thanksgiving. Afterwards the food is distributed to local elderly and lonely people. The school also has links with the George Rider home for the elderly. These have been both formal and informal, involving various children in fund-raising and social activities.
